docs.title: Project layout

docs.text:
In addition to making its source code available publicly, Netified offers and maintains a minimal setup that works out-of-the-box for simple use cases.

This documentation also serves as a blueprint for a complete setup, which is useful for folks willing to maintain larger installations. For the sake of simplicity, we have chosen to use Docker and Docker Compose for this, along with a bash-based install and upgrade script.
docs.title: Self-Hosted API

docs.text:
Our recommendation is to download the latest release of the self-hosted repository, and then run ./install.sh inside this directory. This script will take care of all the things you need to get started, including a base-line configuration, and then will tell you to run docker-compose up -d to start License Manager.

License Manager binds to port 9000 by default. You should be able to reach the login page at http://127.0.0.1:9000.

docs.title: Database Migration

docs.text: License Manager uses the OpenID Connect provider and is not natively compatible with any another authentication provider. you can use Keycloak to add authentication and secure this services with minimum effort with any authentication providers.
docs.title: Authentication Configuration

docs.text:
Below is the default authentication configuration:

{
    "AuthenticationConfiguration":{
        "Authority": "https://license-manager.netified.io/auth/realms/master",
        "Audience": "license-manager",
        "RequireHttpsMetadata": true,
    }
}
docs.title: Configuration

docs.text: It is possible to use Azure Key Vault and configure it in the appsettings.json with bellow configuration.
docs.title: Azure Key Vault Configuration

docs.text:
Below is the default configuration you can override:

{
    "AuthenticationConfiguration": {
        "AzureKeyVaultEndpoint":"",
        "TenantId":"",
        "ClientId":"",
        "ClientSecret":"",
        "UseClientCredentials": false
        "IdentityServerCertificateName": "",
        "DataProtectionKeyIdentifier": "",
        "ReadConfigurationFromKeyVault": false,
    }
}
docs.title: Default Configuration

docs.text:
Below is the default configuration you can override:

{
    "DatabaseMigrationsConfiguration":{
        "ApplyDatabaseMigrations": false
    }
}
docs.title: Default Configuration

docs.text:
Enable Azure Key Vault for dataprotection with following configuration:

{
    "DatabaseProtectionConfiguration":{
        "ProtectKeysWithAzureKeyVault": false
    }
}

The you need specify the key identifier in configuration:

{
    "AzureKeyVaultConfiguration": {
        "DataProtectionKeyIdentifier": ""
    }
}
docs.title: Database Protection Configuration

docs.text:
Below is the default configuration you can override:

{
    "DatabaseProviderConfiguration":{
        "ProviderType": ""

}
docs.title: Default Configuration

docs.text: The identity configuration is used to create/update a user account from your identity service provider.
docs.title: Identity Configuration

docs.text:
License Manager use this property to link a user's from your identity service provider, so it is very important.

By default the identifier is determined by querying the OAuth provider until it finds a value via the nameidentifier field encoded in the OAuth id_token parameter.

Danger

Any modification of this parameter after the initialization of the system can compromise this application. Because the account binding process uses this property to find or create the user's account.
docs.title: Remote Identifier

docs.text:
License Manager determines a user’s display name by querying the OAuth provider until it finds an display name via the name field encoded in the OAuth id_token parameter.

This propery allow easily identify the user in this application.
docs.title: Display Name

docs.text:
License Manager determines a user’s name by querying the OAuth provider until it finds an user name via the preferred_username field encoded in the OAuth id_token parameter.

This property must be unique in the system to identify the user in this application.
docs.title: User Name

docs.text:
License Manager determines a user’s email address by querying the OAuth provider until it finds an e-mail address via the emailaddress field encoded in the OAuth id_token parameter.

This property is used to send a email when the notification is triggered.
docs.title: Email

docs.text:
Below is the default configuration you can override:

{
    "IdentityConfiguration":{
        "RemoteId": "nameidentifier",
        "DisplayName": "name",
        "UserName": "preferred_username",
        "Email": "emailaddress"
    }
}
